page.title: 19THE HOTEL IN KILTARLITY
page.content: Brockie's Lodge Hotel is situated on the A833 1/2km from the village of Kiltarlity.The hotel was originally called the Fraser Arms but was changed by the present owners John and June Forsyth in 1982.The name 'Brockie' is from the Gaelic for badger.Not far from the hotel where the A833 joins the old A9 is Brockie's Corner.The badger theme features strongly in the hotel's interior,as does Scottish wildlife generally. The hotel has 8 bedrooms,a restaurant which seats 50,a lounge bar and a public bar. The charge for bed and breakfast is Â£12.00 per person and a three course meal can be purchased for about Â£3.50.
